intro: Bradleia acuminata, commonly known as the Florida flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands and swamps, where it thrives in moist, acidic soil conditions. Bradleia acuminata has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. It plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
